entries.title: Subscriber
entries.definition: A contact who has opted in to receive communications from you, typically through a blog subscription or newsletter signup. This is the earliest lifecycle stage.

entries.title: Lead
entries.definition: A contact who has converted on your website or shown interest beyond subscription. Leads have typically filled out a form, downloaded content, or taken an action indicating interest in your products or services.

entries.title: Opportunity
entries.definition: A contact associated with an open deal in your pipeline. This stage indicates active sales engagement and a real chance of becoming a customer.

entries.title: Customer
entries.definition: A contact with at least one closed-won deal. Customers are your paying clients and should receive different communications than prospects. Customer retention is typically more cost-effective than new acquisition.

entries.title: Evangelist
entries.definition: A customer who actively promotes your brand. Evangelists provide referrals, testimonials, case studies, and positive word-of-mouth. They are your most valuable contacts for organic growth.

entries.title: Lead Status
entries.definition:
Indicates where a lead is in the qualification process:

  • New - Just entered the system
  • Open - Being actively worked
  • In Progress - Engaged in conversation
  • Attempted to Contact - Outreach made
  • Connected - Conversation established
  • Unqualified - Not a fit

entries.title: Original Source
entries.definition:
How the contact first found your business. HubSpot automatically tracks sources including:

  • Organic Search
  • Paid Search
  • Social Media
  • Referral
  • Direct Traffic
  • Offline Sources

entries.title: Contact Owner
entries.definition: The HubSpot user responsible for the relationship with this contact. Contact owners receive notifications about their contacts' activities and are accountable for follow-up and engagement.

entries.title: Create Date
entries.definition: The date and time when the contact record was first created in HubSpot. This is automatically set and cannot be modified. Useful for cohort analysis and lead velocity metrics.

entries.title: Last Activity Date
entries.definition: The most recent date of any logged activity on the contact record, including emails, calls, meetings, notes, and tasks. Helps identify engaged vs. dormant contacts.
